titleStmt.title: Letter from Angus Paterson to Mrs. N. W. Eppes, Aug. 27th, 1904

publicationStmt.publisher: Florida State University, Office of Digital Research and Scholarship

msItem.title: Letter from Angus Paterson to Mrs. N. W. Eppes, Aug. 27th, 1904
msItem.author: Angus Paterson

editorialDecl.p: Encoded from a digitized version in FSU's Digital Library: http://diginole.lib.fsu.edu/islandora/object/fsu:369556.

opener.dateline:
Madison Fla. Aug 27th 1904
Mrs. N.W. Eppes
Bradfordvile Fla.

body.p: Your letter of the 24th Aust. Requesting the return of the genealogy given me by Mr. John A Pearce has been received.

I have two copies of the geneaogy, and herewith return them both. I have not been able to find anything tangible in the case, and have not been to Europe since I saw you in Tallahassee, I have had some correspondence, but have learned nothing by them.

I was in Tallahassee in May last, but did not have time to go into the country, I went on Saturday and returned on Monday, and did not converse with any of the parties about the estate matter. Hoping that you may find these papers to be what you want, and that I may at some future time see you and Mr. Eppes at your Home.
body.closer:
I am
Yours Respectfully Angus Paterson
